binding.name: note
binding.literal: São Tomé and Príncipe gained independence from Portugal in 1975.

binding.name: label
binding.literal: Democratic Republic of São Tomé and Príncipe

binding.name: note
binding.literal: The country gained its independence from Britain in 1960.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Secessionist state that existed from 1967 to 1970 in South-eastern Nigeria.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Mauritania gained independence from France in 1960.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: A client state of the Roman Empire after 64 BC. Unified by Deiotarus, first king of Galatia.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Bulgaria became People's Republic in 1946 after abolishing monarchy. The Republic followed the Russian pattern, but in 1990 the communist government was forced to resign after demonstrations.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Angola became independent from Portugal in 1975.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: The Republic of Benin was known as Dahomey until 1975. It gained independence from France in 1960.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Chad became independent from France in 1960.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Also referred as Congo-Brazzaville. People's Republic of Congo (1969-1992).

binding.name: note
binding.literal: The Republic of Equatorial Guinea became independent from Spain in 1968.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: The Republic of Gabon was formed in 1960 after it gained independence from France.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Liberia gained independence from the United States of America in 1847.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Mozambique became independent from Portugal in 1975.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Namibia gained independence from South Africa in 1990.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Niger gained independence from France in 1960.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Formerly part of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands. Republic formed in 1981, followed by independence in 1994 after the end of United Nations trusteeship.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Unrecognised state of the former British colony of Southern Rhodesia (modern Zimbabwe).

binding.name: note
binding.literal: The Republic of Senegal became independent from France in 1960.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Former British Somaliland Protectorate. Not recognised by the Somali Democratic Republic.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Gained independence from the United Kingdom in 1962.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: France became a Republic after Louis XVI's monarchy was overthrown by the 1789 French Revolution. France was then controlled by the National Assembly, later to beome the National Constituent Assembly. Defence of the Republic by Revolutionaries was a primary reason behind the Terror of the mid-1790's.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Katanga proclaimed independence from the itself newly independent Democratic Republic of the Congo on 11 July 1960. It was re-adsorbed on January 21 1963.
